mnkgame

Class QuasiRandomPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • mnkgame.QuasiRandomPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MNKPlayer

    public class QuasiRandomPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements MNKPlayer
    Software player only a bit smarter than random.

    It can detect a single-move win or loss. In all the other cases behaves randomly.

                       int N,
                       int K,
                       boolean first)
        Description copied from interface: MNKPlayer
        Initialize the (M,N,K) Player
        Specified by:
        initPlayer in interface MNKPlayer
        Parameters:
        M - Board rows
        N - Board columns
        K - Number of symbols to be aligned (horizontally, vertically, diagonally) for a win
        first - True if it is the first player, False otherwise

      • selectCell

        public MNKCell selectCell(MNKCell[] FC,
                          MNKCell[] MC)
        Selects a position among those listed in the FC array.

        Selects a winning cell (if any) from FC, otherwise selects a cell (if any) that prevents the adversary to win with his next move. If both previous cases do not apply, selects a random cell in FC.

        Specified by:
        selectCell in interface MNKPlayer
        Parameters:
        FC - Free Cells: array of free cells
        MC - Marked Cells: array of already marked cells, ordered with respect to the game moves (first move is in the first position, etc)
        Returns:
        an element of FC
